data.title: Shows A-Z - homeland on showtime
data.text:
view all related dvds | view all related news | view all related listings

[03/28/24 - 10:36 AM]

Claire Danes Will Reunite with "Homeland" Showrunner & Executive Producer Howard Gordon on the Netflix Limited Series "The Beast in Me"

A grieving author finds a new subject in a real estate mogul who was once the prime suspect in his wife's disappearance. Her investigation spirals into a game of cat and mouse that might turn deadly.

[04/07/20 - 10:01 AM]

Video: Showtime(R) Releases Poster and First Look for New Documentary from the Producers of "Homeland," "The Longest War"

The film premieres on Sunday, April 19, immediately following the penultimate episode of "Homeland."

[01/13/20 - 12:09 PM]

Video: Showtime(R) Releases New Trailer for the Final Season of "Homeland"

As previously announced, the series returns Sunday, February 9 at 9:00/8:00c.

[12/06/19 - 09:01 AM]

Video: Showtime(R) Debuts Trailer and Official Poster for the Final Season of "Homeland"

As previously announced, the show's swan song kicks off Sunday, February 9 at 9:00/8:00c.

[09/19/19 - 12:01 PM]

Showtime(R) Programming Advisory

The network details various changes to its upcoming Sunday schedule.

[08/14/19 - 11:20 PM]

Development Update: Wednesday, August 14

Updates include: HBO orders "Skate Kitchen"-inspired comedy to series; Tiffany Lonsdale joins the cast of Freeform's "Siren"; and Josh Berman to bring "St. Elmo's Fire" TV series to NBC.

[08/02/19 - 03:04 PM]

Final Season of "Homeland" to Premiere on Sunday, February 9 at 9 PM ET/PT on Showtime

Starring Emmy, Screen Actors Guild(R) and Golden Globe winner Claire Danes and Emmy and Tony(R) winner Mandy Patinkin, the acclaimed series is currently in production on its final 12 episodes.

[04/24/19 - 11:44 PM]

Development Update: Wednesday, April 24

Updates include: Amy Sherman-Palladino to bring "Ninth Street Women" to Amazon; Nickelodeon issues renewal for "Ryan's Mystery Playdate"; and Stacy McKee exits ABC's "Station 19" as showrunner.

[03/26/19 - 11:06 AM]

Hugh Dancy Joins Season Eight of "Homeland"

Dancy will recur as John Zabel, a savvy Washington consultant who joins the White House as a new foreign-policy advisor to the President and a formidable opponent to Saul Berenson (Mandy Patinkin).

[03/08/19 - 11:47 PM]

Development Update: Friday, March 8

Updates include: HBO's "Crashing," Showtime's "SMILF" get the axe; Finn Jones is FOX's "Prodigal Son"; and Juliet Rylance lands title role in ABC's "The Hypnotist's Love Story."

[01/31/19 - 11:53 PM]

Development Update: Thursday, January 31

Updates include: CBS orders four pilots, including comedy "To Whom It May Concern"; ABC gives "New York Undercover" revival, two others pilot orders; and Showtime pushes final season of "Homeland" to the fall.

[01/14/19 - 11:48 PM]

Development Update: Monday, January 14

Updates include: Matthew Rhys to lead "Perry Mason" at HBO; USA's "Treadstone" rounds out its cast; and Heather Graham-led "The Hypnotist's Love Story" lands pilot order at ABC.

[08/06/18 - 05:09 PM]

Showtime(R) Announces Eighth and Final Season of "Homeland" to Premiere in June 2019

Production on the final 12 episodes will begin in early 2019 in a still to be determined location.

[01/06/18 - 05:33 PM]

Video: Showtime(R) Releases "Homeland" Posters and New Teaser for Season Seven

The network's No. 1 drama series, "Homeland" is currently filming in Richmond, Virginia.

[12/19/17 - 11:21 PM]

Development Update: Tuesday, December 19

Updates include: Comedy Central axes "The Gorburger Show"; Jessie Kahnweiler to pen "The Viagra Diaries" for The CW; and James D'Arcy to recur on Showtime's "Homeland."

[12/12/17 - 10:03 AM]

"Homeland" Season Seven to Premiere on Showtime(R) on Sunday, February 11 at 9 PM ET/PT

Starring Claire Danes and Mandy Patinkin, the cast of series regulars also includes returning actors Elizabeth Marvel, Linus Roache, Maury Sterling and Jake Weber, and joining the cast this season is acclaimed actor Morgan Spector.

[12/11/17 - 11:17 PM]

Development Update: Monday, December 11

Updates include: Alec Baldwin, Kenya Barris team for comedy series at ABC; Hulu's "Battleground" to live on as podcast; and Costa Ronin to visit Showtime's "Homeland."

[11/01/17 - 11:17 PM]

Development Update: Wednesday, November 1

Updates include: VH1 pulls the plug on "Daytime Divas"; Freeform parts ways with "Marvel's New Warriors"; and FOX eyes new incarnation of "24" franchise.

[10/03/17 - 06:03 AM]

Amazon Prime Video Adds "Fearless," from Acclaimed "Homeland" Executive Producer Patrick Harbinson, to Its Original Dramatic Series Lineup

"Fearless" is a legal conspiracy thriller following human rights lawyer Emma Banville (Helen McCrory), whose latest case will uncover a web of secrets and collusion with both personal and national repercussions.

[09/28/17 - 11:36 PM]

Development Update: Thursday, September 28

Updates include: Wendy Mericle brings "Kung Fu" sequel to FOX; Greg Rucka's comic book "Lazarus" set up at Amazon; and Cedric the Entertainer to star in "Ladder 54" for CBS.

[09/26/17 - 11:41 PM]

Development Update: Tuesday, September 26

Updates include: HGTV's "Fixer Upper" to sign off after five seasons; Toks Olagundoye cast in Syfy's "Tremors"; and Courtney Kemp to reboot "Get Christie Love" for ABC.

[09/15/17 - 11:44 PM]

Development Update: Friday, September 15

Updates include: ABC orders fifth season of "The Great Christmas Light Fight"; Freeform parts ways with "Stitchers"; and Marc Guggenheim, McG team for "True Lies" TV series at FOX.

[07/18/17 - 11:17 PM]

Development Update: Tuesday, July 18

Updates include: Annie Potts tapped for "Young Sheldon" at CBS; "Homeland" promotes trio to regulars; and Mykelti Williamson signs onto NBC's "Chicago PD."

[07/13/17 - 10:21 AM]

Showtime(R) Honored with 15 Emmy(R) Nominations

William H. Macy, Liev Schreiber and Mandy Patinkin all received nods.

[07/11/17 - 10:37 AM]

Showtime(R) and Fox 21 Television Studios Bring Emmy(R) Winning Drama "Homeland" to Virginia for Production of Seventh Season

The show's seventh season will premiere on Showtime in 2018.

[02/03/17 - 01:10 PM]

Showtime 2017 Spring Programming Overview

Highlights include new stand-up specials from Nick Cannon, Natasha Leggero, Steve Byrne, Al Madrigal, Andrew Santino and Erik Griffin.

[12/30/16 - 11:29 PM]

Development Update: Week of December 26-30

Updates include: Matt Angel to play George Lucas on "DC's Legends of Tomorrow"; Gabrielle Union settles lawsuit with BET over "Being Mary Jane"; and Burke Ramsey opens a new one against CBS over "The Case Of."

[12/30/16 - 10:00 AM]

Season Six Premiere of "Homeland" Is Available Early Exclusively to Showtime Subscribers

The premiere is currently available on the Showtime streaming service, Showtime on Demand(R) and Showtime Anytime, ahead of its linear debut on Sunday, January 15.

[12/16/16 - 09:38 AM]

Video: Showtime Releases the Official Trailer for Season Six of "Homeland"

Back on U.S. soil, this season focuses on the aftermath of a U.S. presidential election and the transition between election day and the inauguration for a president-elect.

[12/06/16 - 11:17 PM]

Development Update: Tuesday, December 6

Updates include: ABC confirms pilot order for "Libby & Malcolm"; Cedric the Entertainer to star in CBS comedy; and Whoopi Goldberg eyes acting return at Bravo.

[11/17/16 - 11:18 AM]

Video: Showtime(R) Unveils Poster Art and New Behind the Scenes Look at Season Six of Its Emmy(R) and Golden Globe(R)-Winning Series "Homeland"

Season six returns to U.S. soil after spending the last two seasons shooting abroad in South Africa and Berlin.

[11/04/16 - 12:52 PM]

Video: Showtime(R) Releases First Footage from Season Six of "Homeland"

Season six is currently in production in New York, after spending the last two seasons shooting abroad in South Africa and Berlin.

[10/18/16 - 11:13 PM]

Development Update: Tuesday, October 18

Updates include: FX gives third season order to "American Crime Story"; Morena Baccarin signs onto Showtime's "Mating"; and Lyriq Bent cast in "She's Gotta Have It" at Netflix.

[09/12/16 - 11:47 PM]

Development Update: Monday, September 12

Updates include: Jackie Hoffman latest bound for FX's "Feud"; Judy Reyes cast in TNT's "Claws"; and Ben Barnes boards "Marvel's The Punisher" at Netflix.

[08/16/16 - 11:30 PM]

Development Update: Tuesday, August 16

Updates include: E! nixes "I Am Cait" after two seasons; Catherine Zeta-Jones signs on for FX's "Feud"; and Nia Long cast in Lifetime's "Beaches" remake.

[08/11/16 - 04:44 PM]

Showtime(R) Announces Winter Premiere Dates for "Homeland" and "Billions"

Said series are due back on Sunday, January 15 and Sunday, February 19, respectively.

[08/10/16 - 11:41 PM]

Development Update: Wednesday, August 10

Updates include: Jennifer Ferrin joins "Time After Time" at ABC; Aisha Tyler upped to series regular on "Criminal Minds"; FOX gives put pilot commitment to "Ms. Pat."

[07/27/16 - 11:07 PM]

Development Update: Wednesday, July 27

Updates include: Amazon orders "The Last Tycoon" to series; Nelsan Ellis set for arc on "Elementary" at CBS; and Tristin Mays to round out the cast of the new "MacGyver."

[07/14/16 - 11:56 AM]

Showtime(R) Honored with 22 Emmy(R) Nominations

Highlights include five nominations for the hit summer series "Ray Donovan" and four nominations for the network's flagship series "Homeland."

[06/08/16 - 06:06 AM]

Netflix and Binge: New Binge Scale Reveals TV Series We Devour and Those We Savor

Netflix analyzed more than 100 serialized TV series across more than 190 countries between October 2015 and May 2016.

[06/01/16 - 11:57 AM]

"Homeland" Season Six to Premiere in January 2017 on Showtime(R)

The series will return to the U.S. after spending the last two seasons shooting in South Africa and Berlin.

[04/20/16 - 11:27 PM]

Development Update: Wednesday, April 20

Updates include: Jess Weixler tapped for AMC's "The Son"; Ulrich Thomsen to recur on NBC's "The Blacklist"; and Peter Ocko to run AMC's potential drama "Lodge 49."

[03/08/16 - 11:49 PM]

Development Update: Tuesday, March 8

Updates include: A&E gives early renewal to "60 Days In"; Goran Visnjic to chase "Time" for NBC; and Anna Torv cast in "Mind Hunter" at Netflix.

[12/09/15 - 01:07 PM]

Showtime Orders New Seasons of "Homeland" and "The Affair"

Both series wrap their current runs on Sunday, December 20.

[12/09/15 - 07:12 AM]

Nominations Announced for the 22nd Annual Screen Actors Guild Awards(R)

This year's event will be simulcast live on TNT and TBS on Saturday, January 30 at 8 p.m. (ET) / 5 p.m. (PT).

[10/21/15 - 11:36 PM]

Development Update: Wednesday, October 21

Updates include: "Instant Mom" to wrap after three seasons; NBC eyes TV take on "Cruel Intentions"; and Vincent D'Onofrio joins the cast of NBC's "Emerald City."

[09/03/15 - 11:20 PM]

Development Update: Thursday, September 3

Updates include: Keith David to lead OWN's "Greenleaf"; Matt Hubbard, Alexander Cary set up projects at NBC; and Stephen Rider joins the cast of "Marvel's Daredevil" at Netflix.

[09/01/15 - 11:24 PM]

Development Update: Tuesday, September 1

Updates include: Cara Buono, Ross Partridge board Netflix's "Stranger Things"; Gloria Allred to executive produce a potential drama at CBS; and Roberto Aguirre-Sacasa lands "Brides" at NBC.

[08/27/15 - 10:50 AM]

Video: Showtime(R) Releases the Official Trailer for the Emmy(R) Nominated Outstanding Drama Series "Homeland"

Season five will pick up two years after Carrie Mathison's (Claire Danes) ill-fated tenure as Islamabad station chief.

[08/21/15 - 11:49 AM]

2015 Showtime Fall Programming Overview

Highlights include new seasons of "Homeland" and "The Affair" beginning Sunday, October 4.

[07/23/15 - 11:07 AM]

Showtime(R) Announces Fall Premiere Date for "Homeland" and "The Affair"

Look for both series back-to-back starting Sunday, October 4 at 9:00/8:00c.

[07/16/15 - 11:18 AM]

Showtime(R) Honored with Most Lead Actor/Actress Series Emmy(R) Nominations of Any Network or Streaming Service

"Nurse Jackie's" Edie Falco received her sixth nomination for the series' final season.

[07/09/15 - 09:39 AM]

Video: Showtime(R) Releases First Look at the New Season of "Homeland"

Currently in production in Berlin, "Homeland" is the first American TV series to shoot entirely in Germany.

[07/08/15 - 11:36 PM]

Development Update: Wednesday, July 8

Updates include: Susan Sarandon to star opposite Nick Nolte in Epix's "Graves"; Joshua Zetumer's "The Infamous" lands pilot order at A&E; Netflix renews "Between" for a second season.

[06/01/15 - 03:25 PM]

"Homeland" Recruits New Assets for Season Five

They'll join returning series stars Claire Danes, Rupert Friend, F. Murray Abraham and Mandy Patinkin.

[05/06/15 - 10:07 AM]

The Broadcast Television Journalists Association Announces Nominations for the 5th Annual Critics' Choice Television Awards

Said event will be broadcast live on A&E from the Beverly Hilton Hotel on Sunday, May 31 at 8:00/7:00c.

[05/04/15 - 11:38 PM]

Development Update: Monday, May 4

Updates include: HBO's comedy "Living on Video" set for series order; FOX pilots "Minority Report," "Grandpa" begin staffing; and Marton Csokas cast in AMC's "Into the Badlands."

[04/27/15 - 10:08 AM]

Season Five of the Emmy-Award Winning Showtime(R) Drama "Homeland" to Begin Production in Berlin, Germany This Summer

Season five will pick-up two years after Carrie Mathison's (Claire Danes) ill-fated tenure as Islamabad station chief.

[03/10/15 - 11:44 PM]

Development Update: Tuesday, March 10 - Odds & Ends

Updates include: Syfy passes on second season of "Ascension"; Callie Thorne to "Breed" for TNT; and Tim DeKay, Lauren German to star in FOX's "Frankenstein," "Lucifer," respectively.

[03/04/15 - 11:42 PM]

Development Update: Wednesday, March 4

Updates include: Giovanni Ribisi set as "Sneaky Pete" at CBS; Ray Winstone first to board ABC's "Of Kings and Prophets"; and Kris Lemche set as the sole regular on The CW's "Tales from the Darkside."

[02/10/15 - 06:39 AM]

The Paley Center for Media Announces Initial Panelists for the 32nd Annual PaleyFest LA, March 6-15, 2015 at the Dolby Theatre in Los Angeles

PaleyFest is an annual festival that salutes creative excellence and highly acclaimed TV programming, and offers a weeklong pop-culture experience that connects fans with the casts and creators of their favorite TV series.

[01/20/15 - 06:22 AM]

32nd Annual PaleyFest to Honor "Homeland," "Girls," "Jane the Virgin," "Glee," "Modern Family," "Outlander," "Teen Wolf," "American Horror Story: Freak Show," Among Others

Plus: Comedy Central's "Key & Peele," "Broad City," "Kroll Show" and "Workaholics" will be honored with a special salute to the network.

[01/06/15 - 12:28 PM]

Showtime(R) Free Preview Weekend Available to Over 70 Million Homes Starting Friday, January 9

Said offering is timed with Sunday's return of "Shameless," "House of Lies" and "Episodes."

[12/15/14 - 02:14 PM]

"Homeland" and "The Affair" Have Another Great Sunday

Showtime spins the numbers for Sunday, December 14.

[12/11/14 - 08:45 AM]

CBS Corporation Achieves Golden Globe Award Nominations Triple Crown for Third Consecutive Year

The nominations for CBS Corporation are up from last year's 14.

[12/11/14 - 07:12 AM]

Showtime(R) Honored with Nine Golden Globe(R) Nominations, The Most Nominations in the Network's History

"The Affair" is the only first year series to have a lead actor, lead actress and drama series nomination, and is tied for the most nominations for a television series this year with three noms.

[12/11/14 - 05:38 AM]

Golden Globe Nominations 2015

"Fargo" leads all TV nods with five; followed by "True Detective" with four; and "The Affair," "The Good Wife," "House of Cards," "The Normal Heart," "Olive Kitteridge" and "Orange Is the New Black" with three each.

[12/10/14 - 07:13 AM]

Showtime(R) Honored with Five Screen Actors Guild Awards(R) Nominations

Claire Danes, Edie Falco and William H. Macy all received nods for the work on their respective series.

[12/10/14 - 06:12 AM]

Nominations Announced for the 21st Annual Screen Actors Guild Awards(R)

The 21st Annual Screen Actors Guild Awards(R) will be simulcast live nationally on TNT and TBS on Sunday, January 25 from the Los Angeles Shrine Exposition Center.

[12/09/14 - 02:34 PM]

"Homeland" Delivers Its Best Episode Rating and Total Night of the Season for the Third Consecutive Week

Showtime spins the numbers for Sunday, December 7.

[11/25/14 - 01:17 PM]

"Homeland" and "The Affair" Deliver Their Highest Rated Episodes and Total Nights of the Season

Showtime spins the numbers for Sunday, November 23.

[11/24/14 - 12:22 PM]

Showtime(R) to Marathon Current Seasons of Hit Series "Homeland" and "The Affair" Over Thanksgiving Weekend

Both series return with new episodes on Sunday, December 7 starting at 9:00/8:00c.

[11/21/14 - 11:23 PM]

Development Update: Friday, November 21

Updates include: Nora Arnezeder cast in "Zoo" at CBS; Paul Dano joins HBO's "Codes of Conduct"; and Sony Pictures Television pulls the plug on "The Queen Latifah Show."

[11/18/14 - 12:59 PM]

"Homeland" & "The Affair" Deliver Their Best Time Period Ratings and Total Nights of the Season on Sunday

Showtime spins the numbers for Sunday, November 16.

[11/10/14 - 01:04 PM]

Showtime(R) Picks Up New Seasons of Critically-Acclaimed Series "Homeland" and "The Affair"

Both series currently air on Sunday nights starting at 9:00/8:00c on the pay channel.

[10/24/14 - 12:08 PM]

Oscar(R) Nominee Paul Giamatti and Golden Globe(R) Winner Damian Lewis Cast as Leads in the Showtime(R) Drama Project "Billions"

Acclaimed director Neil Burger (The Illusionist, Divergent, Limitless) has signed on to direct the drama pilot, which will be filmed in New York in early 2015.

[10/02/14 - 08:04 AM]

Showtime(R) Amplifies "Homeland" Fan Experience with Showtime Sync

Application users will be able to share select video clips directly to social media platforms instantaneously during new episodes, facilitating social conversation as the action transpires on screen.

[09/29/14 - 01:53 PM]

"Ray Donovan" Ends Season Two with Highest Rated Episode and Total Night in Series History

Showtime spins the numbers for Sunday, September 28.

[09/23/14 - 09:04 AM]

Showtime(R) Launches First Ever Trailer Featuring Tactile Effects with Immersion Technology for "Homeland" Season Four

The trailer is now available in the "Coming Soon" section on the SHOWTIME ANYTIME application on select Android devices.

[08/21/14 - 10:08 AM]

Showtime 2014 Fall Programming Overview

Dramas "Homeland" and "The Affair" will spearhead said lineup on Sunday nights.

[08/11/14 - 11:18 AM]

Showtime(R) to Double Pump "Homeland" on October 5

Plus: newcomer "The Affair" will now premiere a week earlier on Sunday, October 12 at 10:00/9:00c.

[07/31/14 - 11:14 PM]

Development Update: Thursday, July 31

Updates include: Rob Mcelhenny to visit FOX's "The Mindy Project"; Mark Moses among latest bound for Showtime's "Homeland"; and John Stamos to guest on ABC's "Galavant."

[07/18/14 - 05:30 PM]

Showtime(R) Releases Fourth Season Key Art for "Homeland"

Plus: get a first look at the new season, due Sunday, October 5 at 9:00/8:00c on the network.

[07/10/14 - 10:27 AM]

Showtime(R) Honored with 24 Emmy(R) Nominations

The pay channel received the most lead actor and actress series nominations of any broadcast or cable network this year with six nominations.

[06/11/14 - 11:26 PM]

Development Update: Wednesday, June 11

Updates include: Brianna Brown departs ABC's "The Whispers"; NBC gives full-fledged pilot order to Jerrod Carmichael comedy; and Carol Mendelsohn departs "CSI: Crime Scene Investigation."

[06/05/14 - 11:28 PM]

Development Update: Thursday, June 5

Updates include: Jeremy Sisto boards "The Returned" at A&E; Diane Farr cast in ABC Family's "Stitchers"; and Kellan Lutz, Malin Akerman return for HBO's "The Comeback" revival.

[06/03/14 - 11:16 AM]

Laila Robins and Corey Stoll Join Season Four of the Award-Winning Showtime(R) Drama "Homeland"

Robins joins as a series regular in the role of "Martha Boyd," the United States Ambassador to the Islamic Republic of Pakistan, who is professional and put together, with a ship-to-ship voice and the personality to match.

[05/22/14 - 08:38 AM]

Showtime(R) Kicks Off 2014 Primetime Emmy(R) Campaign with Revamped FYC Site

The 2014 Emmy campaign will feature dedicated ads for the network's critically-acclaimed series including "Homeland," "Masters of Sex" and "Ray Donovan."

[05/08/14 - 07:08 AM]

Damian Lewis Joins the Cast of Epic "Masterpiece" on PBS Drama "Wolf Hall"

He will play Henry VIII opposite Mark Rylance as Thomas Cromwell in the much anticipated adaptation of Hilary Mantel's Booker Prize-winning novels which has begun filming.

[05/05/14 - 12:49 PM]

Showtime(R) Free Preview Weekend Available to 74 Million Homes Starting Friday, May 9

Highlights include the highly-anticipated premiere of the new drama series "Penny Dreadful" on Sunday, May 11 at 10:00/9:00c.

[04/04/14 - 09:15 AM]

The Multi-Award Winning Showtime(R) Drama "Homeland" Set to Begin Production in South Africa This Summer

The network's No. 1 rated series, with an average of seven million weekly viewers, will return for season four this fall.

[03/14/14 - 12:15 PM]

Showtime(R) Elevates Nazanin Boniadi to Series Regular for "Homeland's" Highly-Anticipated Fourth Season

Boniadi plays Fara Sherazi, the strong-willed Muslim CIA analyst who Saul (Mandy Patinkin) recruited for her expertise in international banking.

[03/06/14 - 11:48 PM]

Development Update: Thursday, March 6

Updates include: Bebe Neuwirth among the latest cast in CBS's "Madam Secretary"; Spencer Grammer bound for ABC's "Saint Francis"; and Isaiah Washington to return for Sandra Oh's "Grey's Anatomy" farewell.

[02/20/14 - 11:43 PM]

Development Update: Thursday, February 20

Updates include: Elisha Cuthbert tapped as lead in NBC's "One Big Happy"; Morena Baccarin to star in ABC's "Warriors"; Krysten Ritter boards "Mission Control" at NBC.

[02/18/14 - 11:05 AM]

Showtime Anytime(R) Now Available on Roku(R) Players

Subscribers can begin to stream the network's critically-acclaimed hit series, along with box office hits, comedy specials, documentaries, and hard-hitting sports programming on their Roku player.

[02/18/14 - 10:25 AM]

Kelly Ripa and Michael Strahan Stun "Homeland" Star Mandy Patinkin with Two Huge Surprises on "Live with Kelly and Michael," Wednesday, February 19, 2014

Last December, as Patinkin sat down with the hosts, a viewer named Sandy wrote in during the live broadcast to say Patinkin was the first boy she had ever kissed.

[02/12/14 - 11:31 PM]

Development Update: Wednesday, February 12

Updates include: Cristin Milioti is the first to board NBC's "A to Z"; FOX gives series order to Will Forte's "Last Man on Earth"; and Jonathan Ryland is NBC's "Lifesaver."

[01/16/14 - 11:09 AM]

Showtime at TCA: Nevins Tees Up New Season of "Homeland"

Plus: the executive on new series "The Affair," "Happyish"; busted pilot "The Vatican"; and more!

[12/16/13 - 11:18 AM]

"Homeland" Season Three Finale Delivers Series' Highest-Rated Episode and Night Ever

Showtime spins the numbers for Sunday, December 15.

[12/13/13 - 11:17 PM]

Development Update: Friday, December 13

Updates include: TNT greenlights a pair of drama pilots; Rob Corddry boards HBO's "Ballers"; and Matthew Perry to star in, co-write "The Odd Couple" revival at CBS.

[12/11/13 - 07:25 AM]

Showtime(R) Honored with Five Screen Actors Guild Awards(R) Nominations, Tied for the Most Noms in the Network's History

Edie Falco became the most nominated television performer in SAG Awards history with her 20th nomination this morning for Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Comedy Series.

[12/11/13 - 06:20 AM]

Nominations Announced for the 20th Annual Screen Actors Guild Awards(R)

HBO tops all networks with 15 nominations while "Breaking Bad" leads all series with four nods.

[12/10/13 - 10:04 AM]

"Homeland" & "Masters of Sex" Deliver Highest-Rated Episodes of the Season!

Showtime spins the numbers for Sunday, December 8.

[12/06/13 - 07:48 AM]

Discovery Channel Honors the Life of Nelson Mandela with All New Documentary "The Making of Mandela" on Sunday, December 8

Narrated by David Harewood, the film provides a true representation of Mandela's personal story and the crucial key decisions he made throughout his incredible journey to freedom.

[11/19/13 - 11:29 PM]

Development Update: Tuesday, November 19

Updates include: Bill Murray joins HBO's "Olive Kitteridge"; Dwyane Wade lands "Three the Hard Way" at FOX; and MTV extends "Awkward's" fourth season to 20 episodes.

[11/13/13 - 06:24 AM]

Universal Cable Productions Commits to Six Episodes of "Dig" From Keshet Media Group

Tim Kring ("Heroes") and Gideon Raff ("Homeland") are behind the project, which will premiere on USA.

[11/08/13 - 12:14 PM]

WGN America Announces Start of Production on First Original Scripted Series, "Salem"

Janet Montgomery, Shane West, Seth Gabel and Ashley Madekwe star in the project, due to premiere in Spring 2014.

[11/05/13 - 12:32 PM]

"Homeland" Delivers Its Highest Rated Night Ever

[11/05/13 - 10:06 AM]

Kat Dennings and Beth Behrs of "2 Broke Girls" Announced as the Hosts of "The 40th Annual People's Choice Awards" at the Nominee Press Conference

Winners will be revealed during the live broadcast from Nokia Theater L.A. Live on Wednesday, January 8.

[10/29/13 - 11:52 AM]

"Homeland" Delivers Its Highest Rated Episode of the Season!

Showtime spins the numbers for Sunday, October 27.

[10/22/13 - 12:34 PM]

Showtime(R) Announces Pickups of "Homeland" and "Masters of Sex"

Both series are set to return in 2014 with 12 one-hour episodes.

"The Walking Dead" Premiere Was Huge, But "Homeland" and "Masters" Remained Rock Solid!

"Masters of Sex" Grows Nine Percent in Week Two

Development Update: Wednesday, October 2

Updates include: David Tennant to topline FOX's "Broadchurch" import; Colin Hanks cast in FX's "Fargo"; and Emily Rutherfurd to star in ABC Family's "Work Mom."

[09/30/13 - 10:59 AM]

"Homeland" Returns with Its Highest-Rated Premiere Ever

[09/30/13 - 08:40 AM]

Showtime(R) Offers the Third Season Premiere of "Homeland" Available on Multiple Platforms Now

The season three premiere is also available for download as a free video podcast on iTunes.

[09/26/13 - 02:10 PM]

Showtime(R) to Marathon Full Season Two of "Homeland" This Weekend

The series - featuring Claire Danes, Damian Lewis and Mandy Patinkin - returns for a third season this Sunday, September 29 at 9:00/8:00c.

[09/26/13 - 11:15 AM]
